bwwExcerpt: Gaines, who often plays good guys and saps, makes the most of his sympathy capital. At first you feel for his character, especially since he has noble intentions. But then he claims, self-servingly, that “the majority is the most insidious enemy to freedom.” So much for democracy.

keyPhrases.quote: Gaines, who often plays good guys and saps, makes the most of his sympathy capital.

wrongProductionNote: Review is from the 2012 MTC production of An Enemy of the People with Boyd Gaines, not the 2024 production.
